div.head: Aims:
div.p: It was proposed to investigate synthetic paths and crystal structure of thorium and lanthanum polyhydrides (mainly, m Fm3 -ThH 10 and 2 6m P -LaH 16 ) which can be obtained by direct synthesis from metal and hydrogen in DAC with laser heating. Our calculations for ThH 10 and LaH 16 indicated the possibility of existence of high-temperature superconductivity in these phases with T C > 220 K.

div.head: Experimental results:
div.p: Four DACs were used for the synthesis of thorium and lanthanum hydrides at pressures from 80 to 205 GPa. The DAC, loaded by La and intended for synthesis of LaH 16 at 250 GPa, crashed above 205 GPa during the increase of pressure using a pneumatic piston. However, the equation of state for metallic lanthanum was obtained.

The remaining three DACs were used for the synthesis of thorium hydrides using laser heating (YAG laser λ= 1 μm, power up to 100 W) implemented at the station ID27. As a result, novel polyhydrides were obtained: I4/mmm-ThH 4 , 3 6 P mc - ThH 9 ) at 168 GPa before refinement.
